title: Prioritized Interventions for Neurodevelopmental Symptoms — Knowledge Base (Merged) — Modular v1.1

notes: View symptoms as downstream signals of upstream imbalances.
Start with least invasive, system-level interventions before targeted/complex care.
Use genetics as a vulnerability map; environment & nutrition can modulate expression.
Organize interventions as small, testable modules.
Each item includes an Implementation Card to keep actions concrete and trackable.
Non-prescriptive; families should consult clinicians for dosing and medical decisions.

who_it_may_help: Hyperactivity, irritability, headaches, 'wired' behavior
how_to_try: Scan pantry for artificial colors, flavors, preservatives; replace with clean versions.
Swap juices/sodas for water or sparkling water.
Replace boxed snacks with short-ingredient alternatives.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: No change after 2 weeks → move to GFCF; if better but partial → layer omega-3 (EPA-focused).

kb_items.name: Gluten/Casein-free baseline (± soy-free)

who_it_may_help: Eczema, constipation/diarrhea, reflux, behavior spikes after dairy/gluten
how_to_try: Replace breads/pastas with certified gluten-free; swap dairy milk/yogurt with fortified alternatives.
Clear hidden dairy (casein/whey) and gluten cross-contamination.
Consider soy-free for 2 weeks if still reactive.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: No change after 3–4 weeks → consider low-glutamate or low-histamine track; GI consult if severe.

legacy_aliases: Change the diet (remove gluten, casein, sugar, additives, GMOs)

who_it_may_help: Echolalia, stimming, late-day 'wired', headaches, sleep fragmentation
how_to_try: Purge stocks/sauces with 'natural flavors', hydrolyzed proteins, yeast extracts.
Use whole-food broths; protein + whole-food carbs at each meal.
Front-load protein earlier in the day; avoid MSG-heavy restaurant items.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: No change after 2 weeks → layer magnesium glycinate and P5P; if worse, revert and reassess.

kb_items.name: Low-Histamine path (± DAO enzyme)

who_it_may_help: Hives/flushing, 'wired-tired', seasonal allergies, nasal congestion
how_to_try: Reduce aged/fermented foods and leftovers; cook fresh when possible.
Trial an over-the-counter DAO supplement before higher-histamine meals.
Add vitamin C and quercetin/luteolin bundle if tolerated.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: No response in 2–3 weeks → consider SIBO rule-out; if reactive to probiotics, switch to Bifido-forward strains.

kb_items.safety_notes: DAO is a nutrient enzyme; check interactions; for severe MCAS symptoms seek clinician guidance.

kb_items.name: Low-FODMAP (short-term, supervised) for SIBO-like bloating

who_it_may_help: Bloating, gas, abdominal pain, stool changes suggesting SIBO
how_to_try: 2–6 week elimination under guidance; reintroduce systematically.
Pair with targeted antimicrobial therapy if SIBO confirmed/suspected.
Transition to diverse, fiber-positive maintenance diet after.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If symptoms rebound on reintroduction → pursue breath test and clinician support.

kb_items.safety_notes: Short-term only; risk of microbiome narrowing if prolonged.

who_it_may_help: Refractory GI inflammation, poor tolerance to simpler modules
how_to_try: Commit to careful staged reintroductions and symptom logging.
Ensure adequate calories/protein; consider RD support.
Add mucosal support (zinc carnosine) during early phases.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If weight loss or rigidity increases → de-escalate; simpler modules preferred for most families.

who_it_may_help: Sandy stools, urinary irritation, joint pains, vulvar irritation
how_to_try: Gradually reduce high-oxalate foods; avoid abrupt drops.
Increase calcium with meals to bind oxalate.
Support bowels; consider magnesium citrate if constipated.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If symptoms worsen (dumping) → slow down and ensure mineral support.

who_it_may_help: Constipation, post-antibiotic recovery, butyrate support
how_to_try: Start low once daily; increase every 3–4 days as tolerated.
Add to liquids or smoothies; maintain hydration.
Layer with Bifido-forward probiotic after 1–2 weeks if tolerated.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If gas/bloat >10 days → reduce dose or pause; consider SIBO assessment.

kb_items.name: Probiotic goal: constipation-leaning (B. lactis BB-12 anchor)

who_it_may_help: Hard stools, infrequent bowel movements, straining
how_to_try: Single daily dose with food for 2 weeks.
If tolerated, add PHGG prebiotic.
Reassess stool daily; adjust hydration and magnesium as needed.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If no change → switch strain set or add magnesium citrate daytime.

kb_items.name: Probiotic goal: post-antibiotic/loose stools (S. boulardii + multi-strain)

who_it_may_help: Loose stools, post-antibiotic recovery
how_to_try: Use S. boulardii for 1–4 weeks; pair with lacto/bifido multi-strain.
Hydrate and add soluble fiber once stools begin to form.
Re-assess after 2 weeks.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If diarrhea persists >48–72h with fever/blood → medical evaluation.

who_it_may_help: Hives/flushing, seasonal allergies, 'wired-tired'
how_to_try: Start single-capsule Bifido-forward formula.
Avoid histamine-raising strains initially; consider PHGG after 1–2 weeks.
If reactive, pause and pursue low-histamine diet first.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If intolerance persists → assess histamine pathway and consider DAO/mechanistic supports.

who_it_may_help: Bloating, post-meal discomfort, not ready for strict GFCF
how_to_try: Take with first bite of meals containing proteins/carbs/fats.
Assess for changes in post-meal behavior and stool.
Use as bridge while diet changes are trialed.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: No change after 2–3 weeks → discontinue and refocus on diet modules.
product_criteria: Discloses enzyme activities (e.g., DU, HUT, ALU)
Contains DPP-IV if gluten/dairy accidental exposure likely

who_it_may_help: Inflammation, stool irregularity, low short-chain fatty acids
how_to_try: Trial tributyrin capsule with meals OR emphasize prebiotic fibers that raise butyrate.
If using tributyrin, start low due to odor/GI sensitivity.
Monitor stool and behavior.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If intolerance → revert to prebiotic-only approach.

kb_items.name: Mucosal support (zinc-carnosine ± L-glutamine*)

who_it_may_help: Reflux, mucosal irritation, leaky gut signs
how_to_try: Add zinc-carnosine with meals for 4–8 weeks.
Consider cautious L-glutamine if clinician recommends.
Continue probiotic/prebiotic base.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Stop if nausea develops; reassess if no change after 4 weeks.

kb_items.safety_notes: *L-glutamine may not suit all (excitability); clinician guidance advised.

who_it_may_help: Refractory bloating, gas, constipation or diarrhea cycles
how_to_try: Breath test (lactulose/glucose) via clinician.
If positive: short-term antimicrobial protocol + low-FODMAP supervised.
Rebuild with pre/probiotics; liberalize diet gradually.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If symptoms persist despite protocol → evaluate motility, adhesions, or other causes.

who_it_may_help: Sleep fragmentation, constipation, tension, headaches
how_to_try: If sleep: glycinate nightly.
If constipation: citrate in small day doses.
If cognitive: threonate trial daytime.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Loose stools/cramps → reduce dose or change form.

who_it_may_help: Picky eating, poor taste/smell, frequent illness, skin issues
how_to_try: Trial gentle zinc with food for 2–4 weeks.
Pair with copper awareness on longer courses.
Re-test labs if guided by clinician.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Nausea → switch form or lower dose; check copper if long-term.

who_it_may_help: Tics, irritability, low dream recall, methylation prep
how_to_try: Add low-dose P5P with magnesium for 2 weeks.
Observe behavior/sleep; adjust timing.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Over-arousal → reduce or discontinue.

kb_items.name: Folate support (folinic acid or 5-MTHF) – phase 2

who_it_may_help: MTHFR variants, low folate status, CFD considerations
how_to_try: Start with folinic acid if CFD suspected; otherwise 5-MTHF low-dose.
Keep magnesium/B6 in place.
Track behavior for 2–3 weeks.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Paradoxical activation → pause and reassess folate form.

kb_items.notes: Use FRAA/FRAT result to favor folinic acid in CFD.

kb_items.name: Methyl-B12 – phase 3

who_it_may_help: Language delays, attention/focus after phases 1–2 in place
how_to_try: Start very low, titrate slowly (clinician-guided).
Prefer morning dosing to watch for activation.
Maintain magnesium/B6 foundation.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Activation/insomnia → reduce or discontinue; consult clinician.

kb_items.safety_notes: Dosing and route require clinician guidance.

who_it_may_help: Low sun exposure, frequent illness, poor sleep
how_to_try: Check baseline if possible; otherwise start age-appropriate maintenance.
Pair with magnesium; take with fat-containing food.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If high-dose considered → lab monitoring required.

who_it_may_help: Irritability, attention, skin dryness
how_to_try: Start a child-appropriate liquid or softgel with meals.
Aim for higher EPA: DHA ratio at start.
Check for reflux; split dose if needed.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Fishy burps/irritation → switch form or emulsified product.

kb_items.name: Core redox support (C, E-mixed, NAC/glutathione)

who_it_may_help: Oxidative stress signs, frequent illness, behavior spikes with illness
how_to_try: Begin with vitamin C; add mixed tocopherols/tocotrienols.
Trial NAC or liposomal glutathione if tolerated.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Sulfur sensitivity (worsening behavior) → reduce NAC/GSH; consider alternatives.

kb_items.notes: Avoid high-dose E long-term without clinician guidance.

who_it_may_help: Inflammation, irritability, sluggish detox phenotype
how_to_try: Start sulforaphane from stabilized extract or sprouts; add curcumin if tolerated.
Take with food; watch stools/skin.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: GI upset → lower dose or pause; turmeric sensitivity in some.

who_it_may_help: Hives/flushing, seasonal allergies, histamine issues
how_to_try: Quercetin/luteolin bundle before high-histamine meals.
Vitamin C daily divided doses.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Headache/GI upset → reduce dose; evaluate histamine triggers.

who_it_may_help: Low energy, exercise intolerance, attention issues
how_to_try: Start ubiquinol (reduced CoQ10) with fat-containing meal.
Consider alpha-lipoic acid with caution if glucose swings.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Activation or GI upset → reduce; monitor blood sugar with ALA.

who_it_may_help: Attention/motivation, low tone
how_to_try: Start mornings; evaluate focus/energy over 2 weeks.
Combine with omega-3 and magnesium foundation.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Activation/irritability → reduce dose or stop.

who_it_may_help: Low tone/strength, endurance issues
how_to_try: Trial under clinician guidance; ensure hydration.
Track stools and behavior.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: GI cramps/loose stools → reduce or stop; not for kidney disease.

kb_items.name: Mast-cell modulation bundle (quercetin + luteolin + vitamin C)

who_it_may_help: Histamine overlay, seasonal flares, hives
how_to_try: Dose 30–60 minutes before meals or exposures.
Pair with low-histamine eating initially.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: No benefit in 2–3 weeks → reassess histamine path and probiotics.

who_it_may_help: Allergy overlay, chronic congestion, frequent illness
how_to_try: HEPA purifier in bedroom; encase dust-mite-prone bedding.
Point-of-use water filter; fix moisture/mold sources.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: No change after 4 weeks → explore histamine/MCAS or airway path.

who_it_may_help: Sleep onset delay, frequent night waking, morning grogginess
how_to_try: AM outdoor light 10–20 minutes daily; dim lights/screens 1–2h before bed.
Consistent sleep/wake schedule; cool, dark bedroom.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: If persistent snoring/mouth breathing → ENT screen.

who_it_may_help: Habitual snoring, daytime mouth-breathing, restless sleep
how_to_try: Primary care referral → ENT evaluation; consider sleep study if red flags.
Address nasal hygiene; trial myofunctional therapy if indicated.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Normal study but symptoms persist → myofunctional therapy and allergy management.

who_it_may_help: Mouth-breathing, low tongue posture, orthodontic crowding
how_to_try: Weekly exercises under therapist guidance.
Daily home practice; pair with airway hygiene.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Poor adherence → simplify routine; reassess candidacy.

who_it_may_help: Hypotonia, endurance limits, clumsiness
how_to_try: Weekly sessions + home program; track endurance (walk time) weekly.
Layer creatine only if clinician-guided.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Plateau >8 weeks → adjust goals/intensity.

kb_items.name: Feeding therapy (SOS approach) for severe selectivity

who_it_may_help: Severe food selectivity beyond coaching
how_to_try: Weekly therapy; home sensory desensitization and food chaining.
Parallel nutrition: magnesium, zinc, fiber.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Regression or distress → slow pace, adjust chaining steps.

who_it_may_help: Minimally verbal or apraxia features
how_to_try: Trial low-tech boards and simple AAC apps; train caregivers.
Embed AAC in routines; model generously.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: No uptake → adjust vocabulary, increase modeling, consult SLP.

who_it_may_help: Social communication goals, behavior shaping
how_to_try: Weekly coaching; daily 10–20 min practice blocks.
Use simple data sheets to track trials and successes.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Stalled progress → refine targets; add reinforcement variety.

who_it_may_help: Pica, fatigue, restless sleep, low ferritin history
how_to_try: Order labs via clinician; if low, consider repletion with vitamin C.
Re-check after course.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: GI side effects → change form or dose; clinician oversight needed.

who_it_may_help: Muscle tension, headaches, picky eating, frequent illness
how_to_try: Order labs via clinician.
Use results to guide mineral strategy.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: N/A

who_it_may_help: Developmental regression, speech delay with folate issues suspected
how_to_try: Test FRAA/FRAT via clinician.
If positive, prefer folinic acid; consider leucovorin strategies per clinician.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Activation or intolerance → adjust folate form with clinician.

who_it_may_help: Snoring, mouth-breathing, night sweats, restless sleep
how_to_try: Validated questionnaires; consider sleep study referral.
Address ENT issues; myofunctional therapy if indicated.
when_to_stop_or_escalate: Normal study but symptoms persist → pursue allergy/MCAS track.

triage_rules: If Anxiety/OCD has abrupt, severe onset post-infection: prioritize PANS/PANDAS workup immediately.
Before behavior-focused plans, rule out pain (especially GI), sleep deficit, and mineral deficiencies.
When initiating multi-supplement protocols, add one change at a time; monitor response for 1–3 weeks.
Rule out pain (GI), sleep deficit, and mineral deficits before behavior-focused plans.
If snoring, mouth-breathing, or witnessed apneas exist: prioritize airway/ENT evaluation.
Sulfur sensitivity (worse on NAC/GSH) → pivot to non-sulfur antioxidants (vitamin C, E, curcumin) before retrying.
